review: I just plugged it in, to the back of the TV, added the USB cable (plugged in to the USB/diagnostic port on the TV; it's just for power, not data, methinks), and it was done.  Then I installed the Chromecast app. on iDevices, and we were up and streaming Netflix.  (We did already have WiFi in our house.)  We love it.  And, the "screen saver" photos it shows when you are not "casting" anything, are GORGEOUS (and they rotate).

review: I bought this expecting that I could send video off my laptop hard drive to my TV. However, that's not possible. You can only "cast" whatever streams through the Google browser. So, you can watch Netflix, Hulu, etc. but you can already do that with Roku or with most Blu-Ray players and other devices. I contacted Google to be sure and they confirmed that it was impossible to send video off my hard drive. So, I sent it back.
author: Matthew J. Bayan

review: I absolutely love this little thing!  It's so much more affordable than Roku and AppleTV and it's smaller.  I stream free movies and TV shows on Primewire all the time so this works perfectly!  No more leaving the laptop near the TV with an HDMI cord.  Now I'm wireless and I get to play on my laptop while I watch.  I love that you can open your files (only mp4 or mpeg for me) in chrome and cast it.  I signed up for Plex to play the other types of files.  I hope in the future they will allow you to cast from your iphone and ipad chrome browser and add more apps.
